title: Biden Hosts African Leaders for Talks on Security, Trade and Outer Space
description: Nearly 50 African heads of state are attending the first U.S.-Africa summit since 2014. It opened with sessions on civil conflict, democracy and space exploration.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: A Nuclear Fusion Breakthrough
description: Plus Argentina beat Croatia to advance to the World Cup finals.

title: Prince Accused of Plot in Germany Is Said to Have Visited Russian Diplomats
description: Closed briefings by police investigators divulged extensive new plot details to German lawmakers — from death vows to caches of bullets.

title: Targeting One Southern City, Ukraine Hints at Next Front in the War
description: Using missiles and saboteurs, Ukraine is focusing on the city of Melitopol, a vital Russian link to Crimea, ahead of an expected southern offensive.

title: Rishi Sunak Unveils Plans to Tackle Migrant Boat Crossings and Asylum Backlog
description: Amid growing anger within his governing Conservative Party, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak vowed to eliminate the country’s backlog of asylum claims.

title: Belarus Checks Army Readiness as Analysts Say It Is Unlikely to Join Ukraine War
description: President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko of Belarus is a close ally of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, and Belarus relies on Moscow for finance, fuel and security assistance.

title: As Morocco and France Prepare for  World Cup, Historical Tensions Swirl
description: Wednesday’s face-off between the Atlas Lions and Les Bleus will be about more than just soccer, reviving old colonial wounds and fueling identity debates.

title: French Court Convicts 8 of Aiding 2016 Terrorist Attack in Nice
description: The defendants were found guilty of helping the perpetrator prepare for the assault in which he plowed a truck into a Bastille Day crowd, killing 86 people.

title: Violence Grows in Peru After President Pedro Castillo is Ousted
description: At least seven people have been killed in violence that has spread across the country following last week’s impeachment of Pedro Castillo after he tried to dissolve Congress.

title: South Africa Rejects Impeachment Inquiry of President Cyril Ramaphosa
description: A.N.C. lawmakers showed unity in rejecting the call for hearings against their president, giving him a political lift after he failed to report the theft of huge sums of U.S. currency from his game farm.

title: In Libya, Mystery Shrouds Handover of Lockerbie Suspect to U.S.
description: Abu Agila Mohammad Mas’ud, a former intelligence officer accused of delivering the bomb that destroyed a passenger jet mid flight in 1988, was abducted from his home, according to relatives.

title: Concern Grows in Israel’s Military as Netanyahu Nears Coalition Deal
description: Preliminary agreements between Benjamin Netanyahu and his far-right allies have raised questions about political interference in the army’s chain of command.

title: World Leaders Pledge Hundreds of Millions in Immediate Aid for Ukraine
description: President Emmanuel Macron of France told a Paris summit that pledges from political and business leaders would help Ukraine get through the harsh winter as Russian forces continue to attack its infrastructure.

title: Removal of Banksy Work in Ukraine Sparks Debate Around the Future Of His Murals
description: The removal of a Banksy mural sparks a debate about the future of a handful of his works scattered in and around Ukraine’s capital.

title: Despite Soaring Deaths in Somalia, Monitor Says It’s Not Yet a Famine. Some Object.
description: An official declaration of famine would unleash aid and attention. Some experts say Somalia shows that the international system for making the judgment is broken.

title: Europe Reaches Deal for Carbon Tax Law on Imports
description: If approved, as expected, the plan would impose tariffs on countries that fail to take strict steps to curb their greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Indian and Chinese Soldiers Again Trade Blows at Disputed Border
description: Tensions are still simmering two years after a deadly confrontation over a remote region each country claims as its own.

title: As Covid Spreads Fast in China, Beijing Isn’t in Lockdown. But It Feels Like It.
description: Almost no one is venturing out even after an easing of pandemic measures. Cold and flu medicines are scarce, but food supplies appear adequate.

title: Jin, Eldest BTS Member, Enlists in South Korean Army
description: Saying goodbye to the ARMY — as the K-pop supergroup’s fan base is known — and hello to the armed forces, Jin became the first member of the boy band to start mandatory military service.

title: ‘There Must Be More Room for Africa,’ Leader of African Union Says
description: President Macky Sall of Senegal, chairman of the bloc, said in an interview before the U.S.-Africa summit that it’s time for the continent to have more seats in global institutions.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder of FTX, has been arrested and will face criminal charges.

title: Day 13: For a Celebrated Chef, the Tastes and Smells of St. Lucia Day in Sweden Linger
description: In his restaurants, including his latest, Marcus Samuelsson draws inspiration from childhood memories of the Scandinavian holiday.

title: 2 Officers and Bystander Are Killed in Australia Shootout
description: Three other people, believed to be the assailants, were killed by the police during the incident, the authorities in the state of Queensland said.

title: Putin Skips Annual News Conference, Avoiding Possible Questions on War
description: The December event has offered reporters rare — albeit stage-managed — chances to pose hard questions. With the war going poorly for Russia, that could have been awkward.
